step.description: Get Koruza SFP extension PCB panel consisting of two larger SFP socket boards and three smaller SFP plug boards.
Solder the SFP socket to the boards, make sure it is oriented correctly, with the notch away from the rest of connectors.

Solder the SFP cage to SFP socket boards.
Solder IDC connectors to the boards, ckeck their orientation before soldering!

Connect the SFP socket and plug board with SATA cable.
Connect SFP socket and plug boards with the IDC cable.

sub_module_steps.description: Instructions on the installation procedure for KORUZA of its outdor enclosure

step.description: We assamble the square profile to the U-profile (by the slope to the lid at the back part) by the means of screws M4. We pull the screw from inside (the head is inside) and we put the nut M4 from outside. The same on the other side.

We assamble the ringbolt to the L-profile. We put the low nut M12 to the ringbolt, then we insert it into the hole, which is on the surface where there are two oval openings in the middle of the profile. Further, we screw another low nut M12 from the lower side.

Another step is assambling of the antene holder.
a. We put the screws through the holder in the outter direction and then we put it to the side of the L-profile. b. We take the screws from the package of the antene holder and we use three pieces for the assambling of the L-profile. c. We procede as the following: We put the pad from the package on the screw 1; we pull it through the antene holder and we pull it through the middle opening on the side of the L-profile.; we put on it the pad M10 and we put the nut from the package on it. d. In this way, we put to it screws 2 and 3. This assambling (see the picture) makes the tilting down possible. If we want to have the tilting up, we put the screw 3 into the middle and the screw 2 into the opening below the screw 3.

We take the screw M12x75 and pull it through the inside of the square profile into the opening. We put the lockwasher from down and we put on it two low nuts M12. We screw one up in the way, so that the lockwasher is tightened up. The other nut is for securing the position in the oval opening of the L-profile.

Then we take the screw M12x160 and we pull it throug the opening direction the ringbolt and we screw up three nuts, one by one, in the middle of the screw. Then we take the square profile and we put it by merans of the screw M12x75 into the oval opening which is further away from the ringbolt. Then we put the U-profile on the screw M12x160.

Now, we screw another low nut M12 on the screw M12x160 in the hole which remained between the oval openining and the ringbolt. When we screw up the nut, we pull the screw M12x160 through the ringbolt and we screw up another low nut M12. Then we pull the screw M12x160 through the oval opening in the U-profile and we push it to the side of the L-profile and we screw up two low nuts to the L-profile. Thanks to this the screw M12x160 is tightened and will not move.

Now, we screw up two low nuts to the ringbolt. We put to the screw M12x160 another low nut M12. Two loosen nuts secure the tightening of the KORUZA on the screw. After the positioning to the correct position, they are screwed up to the U profile.
In the last step, we screw up on the screw M12x75 one low nut M12, which will secure the KORUZA in the correct direction down or up.
